body:
Thank you for the report, @amatosc.

This is happening because in the `RouterBuilderHelper` we are [creating the Java `Http.Context` using a `RequestHeader`](https://github.com/playframework/playframework/blob/2.6.2/framework/src/play-java/src/main/scala/play/routing/RouterBuilderHelper.scala#L66) and that eventually creates a Java `Request` using a null body:

https://github.com/playframework/playframework/blob/2.6.2/framework/src/play/src/main/java/play/mvc/Http.java#L907-L909

`hasBody` [checks the `Content-Length` header](https://github.com/playframework/playframework/blob/2.6.2/framework/src/play/src/main/scala/play/api/mvc/Headers.scala#L42-L45) and returns true since it is there, but the body itself was discarded before, then the error you are seeing.

I will work on a fix for this problem.

issue.title: Preserve request body when using RoutingDsl

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
## Fixes

Fixes #7682.

## Purpose

Preserve the request body when using `RoutingDsl`. See #7682 for discussion.

body:
Hi @marcospereira, thanks very much for your change.

Is there any way to fix this, until this change is released?  I tried to created my own instance of `RoutingDsl` in instance of inject it, but I got the same result.

PS: Sorry for my dummy question, but I'm a bit new using play 2
@marcospereira Is there any fix how to solve this before the new version is released?
@stefanhartmann123, yes it was fixed by #7684 and #7696.

Hi @amatosc and @stefanhartmann123, we've just released Play 2.6.3 (https://blog.playframework.com/play-2-6-3-released/). If you get a chance it would be great if you could check that this issue is fixed for you. :)

Hi @richdougherty I just tested the code above and I still got a null body :( 
I just updated play's version, might I have to do something else? 
Thank very much.

The fix was made to core Play module, so if you update Play to version 2.6.3 that's all you should need to do. You can verify you're using the correct version by typing `show dependencyClasspath` inside `sbt` and checking that the `play-java` version is `2.6.3`.

I'll re-open this ticket again for now. FYI, here is the unit test that verifies that request bodies are non-null. Perhaps we didn't capture your situation properly in this test:

https://github.com/playframework/playframework/pull/7696/files#diff-a281ba3461ae2127ccba3ae3a8b2d67cR36

This the output of the command, I checked it and all Play's packages that I found are from 2.6.3 version. 

```sbt
$ show dependencyClasspath
 [info] * Attributed(~/.ivy2/cache/com.typesafe.play/play-java_2.12/jars/play-java_2.12-2.6.3.jar)
```

I saw the test and I think, that maybe there are something diferente between how your `application()` method created the app and my loader class, but as I said I just followed the doc.
Thanks for checking. I'll leave this open because we'll need to try and reproduce this bug again.
